summary: Converts a SAM or BAM file to FASTQ.

arguments.summary: The action that should be taken with clipped reads: 'X' means the reads and qualities should be trimmed at the clipped position; 'N' means the bases should be changed to Ns in the clipped region; and any integer means that the base qualities should be set to that value in the clipped region.
arguments.name: --CLIPPING_ACTION

arguments.summary: The attribute that stores the position at which the SAM record should be clipped
arguments.name: --CLIPPING_ATTRIBUTE

arguments.summary: When performing clipping with the CLIPPING_ATTRIBUTE and CLIPPING_ACTION parameters, ensure that the resulting reads after clipping are at least CLIPPING_MIN_LENGTH bases long. If the original read is shorter than CLIPPING_MIN_LENGTH then the original read length will be maintained.
arguments.name: --CLIPPING_MIN_LENGTH

arguments.summary: Compress output FASTQ files per read group using gzip and append a .gz extension to the file names.
arguments.name: --COMPRESS_OUTPUTS_PER_RG

arguments.summary: Compression level for all compressed files created (e.g. BAM and VCF).
arguments.name: --COMPRESSION_LEVEL

arguments.summary: Whether to create a BAM index when writing a coordinate-sorted BAM file.
arguments.name: --CREATE_INDEX

arguments.summary: Whether to create an MD5 digest for any BAM or FASTQ files created.
arguments.name: --CREATE_MD5_FILE

arguments.summary: Output FASTQ file (single-end fastq or, if paired, first end of the pair FASTQ).
arguments.name: --FASTQ

arguments.summary: Google Genomics API client_secrets.json file path.
arguments.name: --GA4GH_CLIENT_SECRETS

arguments.summary: Include non-PF reads from the SAM file into the output FASTQ files. PF means 'passes filtering'. Reads whose 'not passing quality controls' flag is set are non-PF reads. See GATK Dictionary for more info.
arguments.name: --INCLUDE_NON_PF_READS

arguments.summary: If true, include non-primary alignments in the output.  Support of non-primary alignments in SamToFastq is not comprehensive, so there may be exceptions if this is set to true and there are paired reads with non-primary alignments.
arguments.name: --INCLUDE_NON_PRIMARY_ALIGNMENTS

arguments.summary: Input SAM/BAM file to extract reads from
arguments.name: --INPUT

arguments.summary: Will generate an interleaved fastq if paired, each line will have /1 or /2 to describe which end it came from
arguments.name: --INTERLEAVE

arguments.summary: When writing files that need to be sorted, this will specify the number of records stored in RAM before spilling to disk. Increasing this number reduces the number of file handles needed to sort the file, and increases the amount of RAM needed.
arguments.name: --MAX_RECORDS_IN_RAM

arguments.summary: Directory in which to output the FASTQ file(s).  Used only when OUTPUT_PER_RG is true.
arguments.name: --OUTPUT_DIR

arguments.summary: Output a FASTQ file per read group (two FASTQ files per read group if the group is paired).
arguments.name: --OUTPUT_PER_RG

arguments.summary: End-trim reads using the phred/bwa quality trimming algorithm and this quality.
arguments.name: --QUALITY

arguments.summary: Whether to suppress job-summary info on System.err.
arguments.name: --QUIET

arguments.summary: Re-reverse bases and qualities of reads with negative strand flag set before writing them to FASTQ
arguments.name: --RE_REVERSE

arguments.summary: The maximum number of bases to write from read 1 after trimming. If there are fewer than this many bases left after trimming, all will be written.  If this value is null then all bases left after trimming will be written.
arguments.name: --READ1_MAX_BASES_TO_WRITE

arguments.summary: The number of bases to trim from the beginning of read 1.
arguments.name: --READ1_TRIM

arguments.summary: The maximum number of bases to write from read 2 after trimming. If there are fewer than this many bases left after trimming, all will be written.  If this value is null then all bases left after trimming will be written.
arguments.name: --READ2_MAX_BASES_TO_WRITE

arguments.summary: The number of bases to trim from the beginning of read 2.
arguments.name: --READ2_TRIM

arguments.summary: Reference sequence file.
arguments.name: --REFERENCE_SEQUENCE

arguments.summary: The read group tag (PU or ID) to be used to output a FASTQ file per read group.
arguments.name: --RG_TAG

arguments.summary: Output FASTQ file (if paired, second end of the pair FASTQ).
arguments.name: --SECOND_END_FASTQ

arguments.summary: One or more directories with space available to be used by this program for temporary storage of working files
arguments.name: --TMP_DIR

arguments.summary: Output FASTQ file for unpaired reads; may only be provided in paired-FASTQ mode
arguments.name: --UNPAIRED_FASTQ

arguments.summary: Use the JDK Deflater instead of the Intel Deflater for writing compressed output
arguments.name: --USE_JDK_DEFLATER

arguments.summary: Use the JDK Inflater instead of the Intel Inflater for reading compressed input
arguments.name: --USE_JDK_INFLATER

arguments.summary: Validation stringency for all SAM files read by this program.  Setting stringency to SILENT can improve performance when processing a BAM file in which variable-length data (read, qualities, tags) do not otherwise need to be decoded.
arguments.name: --VALIDATION_STRINGENCY

arguments.summary: Control verbosity of logging.
arguments.name: --VERBOSITY

description:
Extracts read sequences and qualities from the input SAM/BAM file and writes them into the output file in Sanger FASTQ format. . See MAQ FASTQ specification for details. This tool can be used by way of a pipe to run BWA MEM on unmapped BAM (uBAM) files efficiently.

In the RC mode (default is True), if the read is aligned and the alignment is to the reverse strand on the genome, the read's sequence from input sam file will be reverse-complemented prior to writing it to FASTQ in order restore correctly the original read sequence as it was generated by the sequencer.

Usage example:

 java -jar picard.jar SamToFastq \
     I=input.bam \
     FASTQ=output.fastq
name: SamToFastq
